title: Towards Energy-Aware Federated Traffic Prediction for Cellular Networks. (arXiv:2309.10645v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Cellular traffic prediction is a crucial activity for optimizing networks in fifth-generation (5G) networks and beyond, as accurate forecasting is essential for intelligent network design, resource allocation and anomaly mitigation. Although machine learning (ML) is a promising approach to effectively predict network traffic, the centralization of massive data in a single data center raises issues regarding confidentiality, privacy and data transfer demands. To address these challenges, federated learning (FL) emerges as an appealing ML training framework which offers high accurate predictions through parallel distributed computations. However, the environmental impact of these methods is often overlooked, which calls into question their sustainability. In this paper, we address the trade-off between accuracy and energy consumption in FL by proposing a novel sustainability indicator that allows assessing the feasibility of ML models. translated_title: 面向能源感知的联合交通预测技术在蜂窝网络中的应用
translated_abstract: 蜂窝网络中的交通预测对于优化第五代(5G)及更高版本的网络至关重要，准确的预测对于智能网络设计、资源分配和异常缓解是必不可少的。虽然机器学习(ML)是一种有效预测网络流量的方法，但大规模数据的集中存储在单个数据中心中，涉及到机密性、隐私和数据传输的问题。为了解决这些挑战，联合学习(FL)作为一种吸引人的ML训练框架应运而生，通过并行分布式计算提供高精度的预测。然而，这些方法的环境影响常常被忽视，这引发了对于其可持续性的质疑。本文通过提出一种新的可持续性指标，解决了联合学习中准确性和能源消耗之间的折衷问题，并对最先进的方法进行了全面评估。
tldr: 本文提出了一种能够考虑准确性和能源消耗之间权衡的可持续性指标，针对蜂窝网络中的交通预测问题提出了面向能源感知的联合交通预测技术，通过联合学习的方式实现了高精度的预测。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a sustainability indicator that balances accuracy and energy consumption, and introduces an energy-aware federated traffic prediction technique for cellular networks. It achieves high accuracy predictions through federated learning.
